page.title: 16FAMILY LIFE ERDINGTON
page.content: For the majority of families the day begins around 7 a.m. when everyone gets ready for work or school. Very few families sit down for a meal in the morning and many - approximately a third - do not eat breakfast at all. For those who do, this is invariably taken in the form of cereal and/or toast. Most family activities take place in the evening and at week-ends. All families have a television and many possess a video recorder. On fine evenings many of the children play outside with friends, while adults tend to have hobbies such as reading, knitting and sewing. Many families keep pets; popular ones being fish, cats, dogs and caged birds. Dispite the loss of contact which this generation often has with the extended family, most people retain a sense of family life in a small unit.
